incidents.name: new-us-west-1 projects fail to come up

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

No further issues have been noticed.

If your project was created in us-west-1 during the affected period, and is stuck in a "Project is coming up" state, it can be deleted and a new project created in its place. We will also be performing this as part of a cleanup in the next few hours.

Additionally, projects that are stuck in a "coming up" state as part of an unpause that was disrupted will be placed back into a paused state. An unpause thereafter should bring them up without any issues.

The fix has been deployed, project creation has been re-enabled.
We are monitoring the results.

A fix is being deployed; project creation is temporarily disabled until the fix has been rolled out.

Existing projects are not affected.

incidents.name: Project creation and updates temporarily disabled

We have re-enabled new project creation and project updates, and are monitoring for any further failures.

We're seeing issues with our upstream DNS provider in the creation and updates of DNS records. We've temporarily paused project creation and updates while the issue is resolved.

Existing projects are not affected.

incidents.name: Project creation and addon updates temporarily disabled

components.description: The studio, docs and primary website at https://supabase.com

incidents.name: Delayed DNS Propagation due to Cloudflare Incident

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

The Cloudflare Incident has been resolved. All operations should be completing as normal now.

We will monitor for any lingering issues that may arise.

Cloudflare is currently experiencing DNS Propagation delays, which means that newly created Supabase projects, paused/restored projects, compute or other add-on changes, and others may take longer than normal to be available.

Until the Cloudflare issue is resolved, we would advise against making any of the above mentioned configuration changes to your project.

You can follow the Cloudflare incident here: https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/incidents/byhy098jxck6
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Small number of projects failing to serve traffic with HTTP 522 error

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
All affected projects have been fixed, and we're monitoring for any other issues.
We've identified an edge case in migrating to IPv6 affecting a small number of projects. A fix is being rolled out to affected projects.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: New project creation, project unpause, and upgrades are disabled in us-east-1 and eu-central-1

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
All project workflows have been re-enabled in us-east-1 and eu-central-1 as of 0200UTC 3rd February, and no further issues have been reported.

We have identified a fix for the resource limitations we are seeing in these two regions, however it will take some time to restore project creation, project unpause and project upgrades in the affected regions.

We estimate that project creation, project unpause and project upgrades in the us-east-1 and eu-central-1 regions will not be available until 01:00UTC 3rd February 2024.

Existing projects are unaffected, as is project creation/unpause/upgrades in other regions.

We're still working on a fix for the resource limitations, and will post updates here as they're tested and rolled out.

Existing projects are unaffected, as is project creation/unpause/upgrades in other regions.
We've identified resource limitations in these two regions and are working on alleviating them.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incident_updates.body: Dashboard access to apse1 has also been restored.
apse1 access has been restored via the API, and access through the dashboard should be restored shortly.
We have identified the source of the capacity issues and are taking steps to re-enable the ability to create new projects and restore projects in ap-southeast-1.

ap-southeast-1 is affected by capacity issues with our cloud provider.

Other regions are unaffected.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We've deployed a fix and re-enabled JWT rolls through the dashboard.
We've temporarily disabled JWT rolls to prevent any additional projects entering a broken state, and are continuing to work on a fix.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We have confirmed that remaining issues are isolated to JWT rolling, and the team is looking into a fix. Other Dashboard actions are working normally.
We're looking into increased error rates, especially with JWT secret rotation, but other actions may also be affected.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We are looking into this issue. Most dashboard and CLI functions are affected. 

Currently running projects are not affected, and we would recommend against making configuration or other changes at this time, until this issue is resolved.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Error connecting directly to some Postgres v13 and v14 projects

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The fix has been deployed, and connectivity for the affected projects should be restored. We will monitor for any changes.
The fix has been deployed, and is currently working through affected projects. We expect this to be done in about 1 hour. We'll update again once all affected projects have been patched.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

There are elevated errors when connecting to Postgres version 13 and 14 free tier projects in the Tokyo, Seoul and Sydney regions. This incident affects direct connections to Postgres and connections via our connection pooler.  If you are connecting via our client libraries or Data APIs, you are not affected.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Storage service unavailable in multiple regions / New Projects Unable to Connect to Supavisor

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We've determined that Supavisor is unaffected by the issue. New projects being unable to use Supavisor was a transient issue due to backpressure, and was automatically resolved.

Storage has been fixed in all regions as well.

We have rolled out a fix for the Storage side, but in the process, discovered that Supavisor is affected by the same issue. This is resulting in newly created projects being unable to connect to Supavisor. Existing projects are unaffected.

We're working on getting a fix out for new projects on supavisor now.
We've found the issue and are currently in the process of rolling out a fix to all regions.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Sending emails is not working for newly created projects that are using the build-in SMTP provider.

incident_updates.body: Things continue to be stable, and we believe this issue to be resolved.

A fix has been implemented, and the default SMTP provider should be working without any issues now.

Please contact https://supabase.help if you're still facing issues.
We are still progressing with rolling out the fix for this issue. It will soon again be possible for projects to send outbound SMTP traffic via IPv4 for our built-in SMTP provider
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Projects created after 29th January 0600UTC are not able to send emails (e.g. invites) using the build-in SMTP provider. Switching to a custom email provider like resend (https://resend.com/overview) that supports IPv6 fixes the issue as a workaround (https://supabase.com/docs/guides/auth/auth-smtp).
We are currently investigating this issue.

We are currently investigating this issue.

us-east-1 and eu-central-1 have also been patched, which completes the rollout of the fix.

incidents.name: Unable to run queries in the Dashboard SQL Editor

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: Increased Logging Infrastructure Error Rates

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

To alleviate the immediate issues, we've shifted logging traffic to new nodes, which are now up and running. Error rates have decreased, and things are looking stable now.

At this point, some logs may still be in queue to backfill, but things should be looking better when looking at and searching logs in the Dashboard.

The Supabase logging infrastructure is currently in a degraded state. This means that looking at or searching logs and some other metrics in the Dashboard may be slow or timeout. These data may also be behind, until this issue is resolved.

There is no impact to running projects, and any currently missing logs should populate as we stabilize the logging infrastructure.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Cloudflare API / DNS Propagation Delays

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

All queues are looking good, and requests should be processing normally now.

If you continue to have any issues, please open up a ticket with our Support team: https://supabase.com/dashboard/support/new

Cloudflare is experiencing issues with its APIs, resulting in DNS propagation delays.

While the Cloudflare incident has been resolved, we are continuing to see some delays as request queues are worked through and are monitoring for any further issues. You can read more about the Cloudflare incident here: https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/incidents/vp0dwbjll8zf

Current services are unaffected; however the following may have slower-than-usual DNS Propagation:

New Project Creation
Project Compute Resize
Project Upgrades
Project Pause/Restore

We would recommend against making changes to project configurations until this is resolved.
We are currently investigating this issue.

A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Control Plane outage

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Traffic to existing projects is not affected. Creation of new projects, and updating properties of existing projects (e.g. auth rate limits) is partially disrupted.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Issues creating new projects/restoring paused projects

Project that were affected in the form of failed resumes have been reset to Paused, and can be resumed from the dashboard as needed.

Our quota has been increased. 

We've re-enabled project creation, and will be re-starting any project resume attempts that were blocked by this soon.

Active projects remain unaffected, and while it should work now, we'd still advise against pausing any instances until this issue is completely resolved.

We have run up against certain resource quotas in the us-east-1 Region and are working with our provider to extend these. We are also evaluating other options to restore project creation and resumption as soon as possible.

Currently active projects remain unaffected. We recommend against pausing any projects at this time.

We have identified the component preventing paused services from being resumed and preventing new project creation.

Currently active projects are unaffected. 

We're looking into possible fixes now.
We believe the issues are restricted to the us-east-1 region. Project creation/restores have been disabled until we've identified and resolved the issue.
We are currently investigating this issue.
